title: Envy03
author: Envy03
content: Please help??Please help??I have forgotten my password but I have my original phrase.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: This belongs to altcoin...All you need to recover your wallet is your seed phrase, import it on another wallet and set a new password.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: As said by CharlesTim, you don't have to worry as long as you've got the recovery phrase of that wallet you're using where your ETH balance is found.I'd like to remind you that don't share it anyone especially that you're just new and you've posted this concern. There could be scammers rotating around and may take advantage of your situation and will try to offer some help, you can do it actually on your own and don't entertain any of them.If you've got more concerns, just ask it on this thread and we'd be happy to help you in any step that may resolve your concern.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: Quote from: Envy03 on January 31, 2023, 02:15:34 PMPlease help??Please help??I have forgotten my password but I have my original phrase. What wallet are you using? This is very important so that we will see how you can recover it.Do you have the recovery phrase or mnemonics? or the master password? If yes then you can recover your wallet by using that Restore->Recovery phrase in MEW.Or maybe if you also have the Keystore file as backup, that's also one way to recover it.

comments.author: mdzahed134
comments.body: Quote from: Envy03 on January 31, 2023, 02:15:34 PMPlease help??Please help??I have forgotten my password but I have my original phrase. I don't know what type of WALLET you are using, if Myetherwallet then there are no reason to worry where you donâ€™t need to password to log in into your wallet, seed phrase is main thing in every wallet. But if you have only restore file when you can't access it without password. Just keep safe your seed phrase.

comments.author: Raflesia
comments.body: As long as you have the seed phrase then it shouldn't be a problem. Follow the steps mentioned by Charles-Tim, I think it's enough to get your wallet back because the password can still be changed there, but it might be a different story if you forget your seed phrase.You just need to change your password again and save it so you don't forget it again.

comments.author: bittick
comments.body: My main concern is if you are claiming own passphrase and how can you feel confused like that. You can sign to your wallet with your passphrase. I think what you meant about keystore not passphrase. You should check it again. I think that you are misstyping or something else. It's caused by once you are still owning pass phrase and that means if you have access to your wallet.

comments.author: visionE2
comments.body: Quote from: Envy03 on January 31, 2023, 02:15:34 PMPlease help??Please help??I have forgotten my password but I have my original phrase. if you saved the seed phrase I think it will be easy, If you are using Metamask you just need to re-import your seed phrase and use the new password.Hopefully this will be a lesson for you, anything related to your Wallet must be stored properly. Don't carelessly save something important it's still good you just forgot the password how you forgot to save the seed phrase.

comments.author: TastyChillySauce00
comments.body: Quote from: Envy03 on January 31, 2023, 02:15:34 PMPlease help??Please help??I have forgotten my password but I have my original phrase.  So, what is that kind of original phrase? You shall rephrase your question again. It seems you didn't even know how to separate between pass phrase and another kind of file like keystore that needs a password to open it. I guess that if you are saying password has become the main concern that prevents you to access your wallet and this must not be your phrase as the main problem. It shall be another file that linked to your wallet caused by it has been protected by password.If you are still having another key like private key or passphrase that contains some words depending on the blockchain and you can access your wallet again without using password.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Envy03 on January 31, 2023, 02:15:34 PMPlease help??Please help??I have forgotten my password but I have my original phrase. The password you see is usually for encrypting your wallet so that once a stranger lands on the wallet file, he can't access your wallet minus entering your password. if you have access to the seed phrase, then all you need is restore the wallet in the wallet software.The password maybe important, but the seed phrase is the most important. Keep it safely. If the hacker lands on it, he won't need the password to access your funds.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: Envy03 on January 31, 2023, 02:15:34 PMI have forgotten my password but I have my original phrase. If you have your original phrase (do you mean your seed phrase), you are fine because you can import it and recover your wallet.Search with Google and name of your wallet software (Metamask, SafePal, c98, Myetherwallet ...) and recover from seed. Follow their guides to import and recover.You were panic because you did not understand the role of password that is encrypted your wallet and prevent strangers, hackers to access your wallet. If you have seed phrase, you can recover it and set a new password to encrypt that new wallet file.When you recover your wallet, you must add custom chain if your fund is not in Ethereum chain. By default setting, wallet software, extension will show your wallet balance in ERC20 Ethereum chain. For Binance Smart Chain, Harmony, Avalanche you must add custom chains.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: Quote from: Envy03 on January 31, 2023, 02:15:34 PMPlease help??Please help??I have forgotten my password but I have my original phrase. Hi Op, is everything under control? where you have do suggestions from members in this forum, hopefully you can do this and can secure your funds in the wallet after that don't forget to write down the new password that you have created in the new wallet, and please notify your success in your thread is so we know that what have suggest is working properly, suggestions never store important things about our wallet in online storage that is connected to the internet so that they don't get hacked.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Ethereum is a token and there's no such password since it's not a wallet or exchange.If you mean you lost password on your wallet or exchange that contain Ethereum token, well it will depends on the storage.If you store your Ethereum in your non custodial wallet, you can retrieve it using your seed phrase to access your wallet. But if it's an exchange, you need to contact the exchange and ask them how to access your account.

comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: If you still have your original seed phrase, you may use it to reset your forgotten password. All that is required is to use the seed phrase you were given with another wallet program. Metamask, SafePal, c98, and Myetherwallet are just a few of the many solutions available.You may recover your wallet by searching for "recover from seed phrase" and the name of your wallet program. If you have any questions or need help, please contact the wallet's support team.The most crucial piece of cryptographic information to safeguard is the seed phrase, therefore it's fantastic that you have it. Your money will be safe, and resetting your password will be a breeze using this.

comments.author: Sterbens
comments.body: As many people here have said, if you have the seed phrase then your wallet will be accessible again unless you forget it. Follow the method that has been said a lot here.I understand this may be your first experience and it makes you confused and even panicked. Don't panic about what you are experiencing, especially if you have a seed phrase, you just need to restore it.

comments.author: wxa7115
comments.created_time: February 03, 2023, 05:24:08 AMLast edit: February 09, 2023, 03:37:21 AM by wxa7115
comments.body: Quote from: Envy03 on January 31, 2023, 02:15:34 PMPlease help??Please help??I have forgotten my password but I have my original phrase. Whenever you create a wallet you are given very clear instructions about writing down all the information related to it, this includes the seed words, the password and any other information necessary for the recovery of your account.If you have your seed words then there is no problem and you can recover your coins easily, however it is worrying you state you forgot your password, did you refuse to write down all the information necessary to recover your wallet? Because even if you can recover it if you are not careful then next time you could find yourself in a situation where you lose your coins for good, so take the time to write that information and make a copy you keep in a safe place in the case you misplace or forget that information again.

comments.author: Xampeuu
comments.body: Until now, no one has been able to recover the lost private key or seed phrase, except if it is stored somewhere and remembers where it was stored, maybe we can access our wallet again. but if we don't save it or lose it, of course we will lose our assets even forever. therefore the longer it will be the more coins will be frozen due to incidents like this. After that, we can use things like this as a lesson so that in the future it will not happen again if we create a new wallet
